pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [a9d5b621ef](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23067/commits/a9d5b621efbb101f43a0d33403b2cd9395a64244)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.LaurentSeries`|1|
| `Mathlib.Topology.UniformSpace.DiscreteUniformity` (new file)|1001|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ DiscreteUniformity`
`+ _root_.UniformSpace.DiscreteUnif.cauchyConst`
`+ _root_.UniformSpace.DiscreteUnif.cauchy_le_pure`
`+ _root_.UniformSpace.DiscreteUnif.eq_const_of_cauchy`
`+ _root_.discreteUniformity_iff_eq_principal_idRel`
`+ cauchyConst`
`+ eq_principal_idRel`
`+ eq_pure_cauchyConst`
`+ eq_pure_of_cauchy`
`+ idRel_mem_uniformity`
`+ idRel_mem_uniformity_iff`
`+ instance (X : Type*) : @DiscreteUniformity X ‚ä•`
`+ instance : CompleteSpace X`
`+ instance : DiscreteTopology X`
`+ instance [Group X] : UniformGroup X`
`+ instance {Y : Type*} [UniformSpace Y] [DiscreteUniformity Y] :`
`+ uniformContinuous`
`- DiscreteUnif.cauchyConst`
`- DiscreteUnif.cauchy_le_pure`
`- DiscreteUnif.eq_const_of_cauchy`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
IIRC @faenuccio wanted to be in the loop regarding this

> @faenuccio Are you okay with the name changes I suggest?

Yes, indeed. I just added some periods at the end of doc-sentences, but apart from this LGTM.
@faenuccio Are you okay with the name changes I suggest?
Here are some very small suggestions before I go teaching.
@faenuccio Are you okay with the name changes I suggest?

```suggestion
    rw [DiscreteUniformity.eq_bot (X := X), UniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace_bot]
```

```suggestion
/-- The discrete uniformity -/
@[mk_iff discreteUniformity_iff_eq_bot]
```

Do you know about this trick?
No, what does it do?
Well, I found what it does!

```suggestion
  eq_bot : u = ‚ä•
```

With the `mk_iff` suggestion above, you can do:
```suggestion
theorem _root_.discreteUniformity_iff_eq_principal_idRel {X : Type*} [UniformSpace X] :
    DiscreteUniformity X ‚Üî uniformity X = principal idRel := by
  rw [discreteUniformity_iff_eq_bot, UniformSpace.ext_iff, Filter.ext_iff]
  rfl

theorem eq_principal_idRel : uniformity X = principal idRel :=
  discreteUniformity_iff_eq_principal_idRel.mp inferInstance
```

This is still not ideal because [UniformSpace.ext_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/UniformSpace/Defs.html#UniformSpace.ext_iff) is not stated as an equality of filters for some reason... But I'd say it's still a bit cleaner.

Also I changed the name to match common practice, although I'm not sure I love this "de-namespacing" habit.

Please add the `iff` version as well, probably using [UniformSpace.uniformSpace_eq_bot](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/UniformSpace/Basic.html#UniformSpace.uniformSpace_eq_bot).
I can't find it right now, but there should be a lemma saying that uniform continuity is the same as some inequality of uniform structures, could you use that?

Perhaps one thing that would work is
```suggestion
theorem uniformContinuous {Y : Type*} [UniformSpace Y] (f : X ‚Üí Y) :
    UniformContinuous f := by
  simp only [uniformContinuous_iff_eventually, eventually_iff, eq_principal_idRel,
    mem_principal, idRel_subset, Set.mem_setOf_eq]
  exact fun _ ha _ ‚Ü¶ mem_uniformity_of_eq ha rfl
```
if this is what @ADedecker has in mind.

I think @ADedecker hoped for that
```
variable {x} in
/-- On a space with a discrete uniformity, any function is uniformly continuous -/
theorem uniformContinuous {Y : Type*} [UniformSpace Y] (f : X ‚Üí Y) :
    UniformContinuous f := by
  simp only [uniformContinuous_iff, DiscreteUniformity.eq_bot, bot_le]

```
Indeed, Antoine's version is what I had in mind.

```suggestion
    DiscreteUniformity (X √ó Y) := by
  simp [discreteUniformity_iff_eq_principal_idRel, uniformity_prod_eq_comap_prod, 
    eq_principal_idRel, idRel, Set.prod_eq, Prod.ext_iff, Set.setOf_and]
```

```suggestion
theorem eq_pure_of_cauchy {Œ± : Filter X} (hŒ± : Cauchy Œ±) : ‚àÉ x : X, Œ± = pure x := by
```

Let's fix this name while you're at it.

```suggestion

@[deprecated (since := "2025-03-23")]
alias _root_.UniformSpace.DiscreteUnif.cauchy_le_pure := cauchy_eq_pure

```

```suggestion
    exact ‚ü®x, pure_le_nhds x‚ü©
```
No need to invoke the specialization order here!

```suggestion

@[deprecated (since := "2025-03-23")]
alias _root_.UniformSpace.DiscreteUnif.cauchyConst := cauchyConst

```

```suggestion
theorem eq_pure_cauchyConst {Œ± : Filter X} (hŒ± : Cauchy Œ±) : Œ± = pure (cauchyConst hŒ±) :=
```

```suggestion

@[deprecated (since := "2025-03-23")]
alias _root_.UniformSpace.DiscreteUnif.eq_const_of_cauchy := eq_pure_cauchyConst

```

```suggestion
The discrete uniformity is the smallest possible uniformity, the one for which
```

```suggestion
/-- The discrete uniformity induces the discrete topology. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The bot uniformity is the discrete uniformity. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- A product of spaces with discrete uniformity has a discrete uniformity. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- On a space with a discrete uniformity, any function is uniformly continuous. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The discrete uniformity makes a group a `UniformGroup. -/
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive "The discrete uniformity makes an additive group a `UniformAddGroup`."]
```

```suggestion
/-- The discrete uniformity makes a space complete. -/
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/UniformSpace/DiscreteUniformity): discrete uniformity
